title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.7 - Restrictions on purchases and sales
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.7 - Restrictions on purchases and sales

State Regulations
A permit must be obtained whether the merchandise is tax
paid or is in a bonded warehouse or customs bonded warehouse. (a) Alcoholic beverages may be purchased by
permittees under this section only from a duly licensed manufacturer or
wholesaler in accordance with the terms of the vendor's license. (b) Alcoholic beverages sold by permittees
under this section may be sold only to duly licensed manufacturers, wholesalers
or retailers and in accordance with the terms of the purchaser's
license. (c) Warehouse receipts, certificates or other documents issued for the storage of liquor or wine in
bulk, may be sold by a permittee bank under this section only to duly licensed
manufacturers and wholesalers. (d) Warehouse receipts, certificates, or other documents issued for the storage of
liquors and/or wines in the original sealed containers not exceeding one quart
each of liquor or 15 gallons each of wine may be sold by a permittee bank under
this section only to duly licensed wholesalers and retailers. (e) Sales of alcoholic beverages by
permittees under this section may be held only on licensed premises or on
premises for which a warehouse permit has been issued by the Liquor

Authority. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
33.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
